title_full: SAP06-BP01 Understand security standards and how they apply to your SAP workload
title: Understand security standards and how they apply to your SAP workload
description: Understand and implement security standards relevant to your SAP workloads including industry regulations (GDPR, SOX, HIPAA), SAP security guidelines, and AWS security best practices. Maintain a security baseline that addresses all applicable compliance requirements.

title_full: SAP06-BP02 Implement SAP security notes and patches regularly
title: Implement SAP security notes and patches regularly
description: Establish a regular process for reviewing and implementing SAP Security Notes. Monitor SAP Security Patch Day releases and assess the criticality of each note for your environment. Maintain a patching schedule that minimizes security exposure while managing operational risk.

title_full: SAP07-BP01 Implement identity and access management for SAP workloads
title: Implement identity and access management for SAP workloads
description: Implement comprehensive identity and access management for SAP workloads using AWS IAM for infrastructure access and SAP authorization concepts for application access. Integrate with enterprise identity providers using SAML or OIDC federation.

title_full: SAP07-BP02 Use AWS IAM roles for SAP system access to AWS services
title: Use AWS IAM roles for SAP system access to AWS services
description: Configure SAP systems to use AWS IAM roles instead of static credentials for accessing AWS services. Attach IAM roles to EC2 instances running SAP workloads with least-privilege permissions for required AWS API operations.

title_full: SAP07-BP03 Implement SAP Single Sign-On with AWS Directory Services
title: Implement SAP Single Sign-On with AWS Directory Services
description: Configure SAP Single Sign-On (SSO) integration with AWS Directory Services or Microsoft Active Directory. Enable seamless authentication for SAP users while maintaining centralized identity management and reducing password fatigue.

title_full: SAP08-BP01 Protect data at rest in SAP systems
title: Protect data at rest in SAP systems
description: Enable encryption for data at rest in SAP systems using Amazon EBS encryption, Amazon S3 server-side encryption, and database-level encryption. Use AWS Key Management Service (KMS) to manage encryption keys with appropriate key rotation policies.

title_full: SAP08-BP02 Protect data in transit for SAP communications
title: Protect data in transit for SAP communications
description: Configure encryption for data in transit including SAP GUI connections using SNC (Secure Network Communications), RFC connections between SAP systems, and HTTPS for web-based interfaces. Use TLS 1.2 or higher for all communications.

title_full: SAP08-BP03 Implement SAP HANA database encryption
title: Implement SAP HANA database encryption
description: Enable SAP HANA native encryption features for data volumes, log volumes, and backups. Configure encryption key management and rotation according to your security policies. Consider using AWS CloudHSM for FIPS 140-2 Level 3 validated key storage.

title_full: SAP09-BP01 Implement network security for SAP workloads
title: Implement network security for SAP workloads
description: Design network architecture for SAP workloads using Amazon VPC with appropriate subnet segmentation. Implement security groups and network ACLs to control traffic flow between SAP system tiers and external networks.

title_full: SAP09-BP02 Use private connectivity for SAP integrations
title: Use private connectivity for SAP integrations
description: Establish private connectivity for SAP integrations using AWS PrivateLink, AWS Direct Connect, or VPN connections. Avoid exposing SAP systems directly to the internet and use AWS WAF and AWS Shield for web-facing components.

title_full: SAP09-BP03 Have a documented plan for responding to security events
title: Have a documented plan for responding to security events
description: Develop and maintain an incident response plan specific to SAP workloads on AWS. Define roles and responsibilities, escalation procedures, and communication protocols. Conduct regular tabletop exercises to validate the plan and identify improvement areas.

title_full: SAP10-BP01 Enable security logging and monitoring for SAP workloads
title: Enable security logging and monitoring for SAP workloads
description: Enable comprehensive security logging including AWS CloudTrail, VPC Flow Logs, SAP Security Audit Log (SM21), and database audit logs. Centralize logs using Amazon CloudWatch Logs or Amazon S3 for analysis and long-term retention.

title_full: SAP10-BP02 Use Amazon GuardDuty for threat detection on SAP workloads
title: Use Amazon GuardDuty for threat detection on SAP workloads
description: Enable Amazon GuardDuty to detect potential security threats to your SAP infrastructure. Configure GuardDuty findings to trigger alerts and automated response actions through Amazon EventBridge and AWS Lambda.
